meanings.definition: Support or prop up with a crutch.
meanings.sent1: She was crutching her injured leg after the accident.
meanings.sent2: The injured man was crutching his way slowly down the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried crutching on a stick, thinking it was a crutch.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was crutching her through the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge was crutching the weight of the heavy truck.

meanings.definition: The act of using crutches for support.
meanings.sent1: His crutching helped him move around after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The crutching made her feel more independent.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's crutching on ice skates was a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: The crutching of the tree branches created a canopy of shade.
meanings.sent5: The crutching of the building's pillars ensured its stability.

meanings.definition: To lean on or depend on for assistance or support.
meanings.sent1: She was crutching on her friends for emotional support.
meanings.sent2: The team was crutching on their star player to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The student was crutching on his lucky pen to pass the exam.
meanings.sent4: Her crutching on caffeine to stay awake was becoming a habit.
meanings.sent5: The country was crutching on foreign aid to rebuild after the disaster.
